title: Electric PE - find greatest Delta V from U-x graph

content.description: A test charge is moved along the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"> <mi>x</mi> </math>-axis in a region with an electric field. The graph shows the electric potential energy <math alttext="U of x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>U</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> of the test charge-field system as a function of the test chargeâ€™s position <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>. Four labeled points <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>, <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>, and <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></math> are indicated on the graph.
content.question: Between which two labeled points is the magnitude of the change in electric potential the greatest?

choices.label: <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>
<math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></math>
<math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> and <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></math>
<math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> and <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
